messages.content: Tell me about his work experience.

John has over 12 years of experience in frontend development. He has worked on various projects, including e-commerce platforms, web applications, and content management systems. John has experience working with startups, agencies, and large corporations, which has given him a broad perspective on the industry.
Does John have teaching experience?

Yes! John taught Web Design at Universidad Autónoma de Occidente. He guided students in learning UX/UI design and frontend development, inspiring them with the latest technologies. His passion for teaching has also helped him become a great mentor in his professional roles. Interested in how his teaching skills translate into his current work?
Can you tell me about John's current job?

Sure! John is currently working as a Lead Frontend Developer at Valtech since July 2021. He’s responsible for delivering high-quality frontend solutions for clients in the USA, focusing on Vue 3 and React. He also uses Contentful and Contentstack to handle content and provides UX/UI advice to improve accessibility. Want to hear more about his responsibilities at Valtech?
What did John do at MAS Global?

At MAS Global, John worked as a Mid Senior Frontend Developer from March 2020 to July 2021. He built new frontend features using Angular 8 and vanilla JavaScript and supported clients in the cultural sector, such as museums and theaters. John also provided UX/UI advice to improve accessibility. Want to know more about a specific project from his time there?
Tell me about John's role at Keyrus Colombia.

John worked as a Lead Frontend Developer at Keyrus Colombia from September 2019 to March 2020. He led the frontend processes for a major client, focusing on UX/UI consultation and web development using Hybris and Vue. John also reviewed pull requests to ensure best frontend development practices. Would you like to know more about the technologies he used there?
What was John's role at Studio F?

At Studio F, John was the Lead Frontend Developer and UX/UI Designer from September 2018 to September 2019. He led major UX/UI projects to optimize websites for better user experiences and higher conversion rates. He also led the frontend UI refactor and developed digital resources using HTML, CSS, SASS, JS, and Vtex. Would you like to know more about his UX/UI work?
Can you tell me about John's experience as a teacher?

Certainly! John taught Web Design at Universidad Autónoma de Occidente from January 2017 to September 2018. He led student groups in learning about UX/UI design and frontend development, helping them engage with new technologies. His teaching experience helped shape his mentorship skills. Interested in how his teaching influenced his development career?
What about John's freelance experience?

John worked as a freelancer on Upwork from July 2015 to September 2018, providing frontend development, UX/UI design, and graphic design services for clients in the USA, England, Australia, and Spain. He worked with HTML, CSS/SASS, Vue and vanilla JS. He also communicated regularly with clients to refine tasks and deploy projects to production.
Tell me about his work at Bennet School.

At Bennet School, John was a Multimedia Designer from September 2015 to September 2016. He planned and executed multimedia projects, including video and sound editing. John also designed and coded email templates in HTML, providing multimedia solutions to enhance the school's digital presence. Interested in learning more about the multimedia projects he worked on?
What was John's role at Salamandra?

At Salamandra, John worked as a Graphic and Multimedia Designer from February 2014 to February 2015. He was responsible for planning multimedia projects such as videos, sound editing, and presentations. He also designed marketing materials, including brochures and packaging, and handled frontend development using Drupal. Would you like to know more about his role at Salamandra?
What is Studio F and what did John do there?

Studio F is a leading Latin American fashion brand, specializing in women's clothing and accessories. At Studio F, John worked as the Lead Frontend Developer and UX/UI Designer. He led the refactor of their e-commerce frontend, utilizing modern technologies like HTML, CSS, SASS, JavaScript, and Vtex. His efforts resulted in improved user experience and performance, reducing complaints and increasing customer satisfaction.
